intro: Grammitis turrialbae, commonly known as the Turrialba fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically dark green and glossy. This plant is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Grammitis turrialbae has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces small, inconspicuous spore-bearing structures on the underside of its leaves. It is often found growing on tree trunks or in the understory of humid forests.
